name: python-mint

pre_pr_migrator_status.python311: not solvable (bot CI job): main: ['linux_64_python3.11.____cpython: Encountered problems while solving: - package vtk-9.1.0-no_osmesa_py310h2e30e98_101 requires tbb >=2020.2,<2021.0.0a0, but none of the providers can be installed ', 'osx_64_python3.11.____cpython: Encountered problems while solving: - package vtk-9.1.0-no_osmesa_py310hcfb708b_101 requires python_abi 3.10.* *_cp310, but none of the providers can be installed ', 'win_64_python3.11.____cpython: Encountered problems while solving: - package vtk-9.1.0-no_osmesa_py310h4ada9a1_100 requires tbb >=2020.2,<2021.0.0a0, but none of the providers can be installed ']

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.27.4" %}
{% set vtk_version = "9.2.2" %}

package:
  name: python-mint
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/pletzer/mint/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c7b977def5fc99f3de590439557cacc252911eec02cb64113b6d426d4e07fd7a 

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [py<38]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vvv

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ cdt('mesa-libGL-devel') }}  # [linux]
  host:
    - python
    - cython
    - pip
    - setuptools
    - tbb-devel
    - vtk ={{ vtk_version }}
    - scitools-iris
  run:
    - python
    - numpy
    - netcdf4
    - vtk ={{ vtk_version }}
    - scitools-iris

test:
  imports:
    - mint

about:
  home: https://github.com/pletzer/mint
  license: 0BSD
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: Mimetic INTerpolation on the Sphere.
  description: |
    mint regrids edge centred fields from a source to a destination grid.
    The grid is stored as a collection of grid cells, each having four vertices
    (i.e., the cells are quadrilaterals) in longitude-latitude space. 
    The edge field is stored as integrals of a vector field along each edge. 
    The regridding method is mimetic in the sense that
    Stokes's theorem is satisfied to near machine precision. In particular, the
    loop integrals of an interpolated vector field deriving from a gradient is zero.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - pletzer
    - bjlittle
